result.title: Iron Mountain: Discounted Valuations, Richer Yields, & Resilient AI/Legacy Business Monetization
result.text: IRM is an even better Buy after the steep correction, thanks to the robust data center monetization trends and the resilient legacy RIM business for excellent capital appreciation/dividend returns. The data center segment drives profitable, high growth trends while being supported by aggressive capex, strong leasing pipelines, and higher renewal rates. IRM's main monetization avenue through legacy RIM/storage business remains resilient to the rapidly changing industry trends, thanks to the wide customer base with lease terms at ~14.5 years.

result.title: Iron Mountain: Business Issues And High Valuation Make Me Wary (Downgrade)
result.text: Iron Mountain Incorporated has shifted toward data centers and digital solutions, driving double-digit revenue growth but not translating into sustainable free cash flow. IRM's aggressive use of non-GAAP metrics and rising leverageactual net debt/EBITDA near 7.8xraises material concerns about transparency and financial health. Despite a 10% dividend hike and a 4% yield, IRM's cash burn and high debt levels threaten long-term sustainability and credit quality.

result.title: Iron Mountain: King Of Storage And Dispositions Offers Robust Return Prospects
result.text: IRM's Matterhorn Strategy: Accelerating Growth has worked out brilliantly, with it triggering the accelerated Growth Businesses segment at a 4Y CAGR of +20%. This builds upon the expansion of Growth Businesses revenue share at 28% in 2025, up from 15% in 2021, thanks to their ability to cross-sell its vertically integrated storage solutions. IRM's aggressive data center investments have already bore fruit, with it providing an excellent line of sight to 2026 data center revenues of $1B (5Y CAGR of +25%).

result.title: Iron Mountain: Derisked Fundamentals Make The Bull Case Attractive (Rating Upgrade)
result.text: Iron Mountain is upgraded to a buy rating, reflecting a de-risked data center business and robust long-term growth drivers. IRM's data center segment boasts a massive pre-leased backlog, strong pricing power, and expanding margins, supporting visible revenue and cash flow growth. ALM and Digital Solutions are scaling rapidly, with significant cross-sell potential and new government contracts enhancing recurring revenue and adoption runway.
